raid.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a short attack on a place by soldiers, planes, or ships, intended to cause damage but not take control
raid.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The army launched several cross-border raids last night.
The colonel led a successful raid against a rebel base.
raid.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a surprise visit made to a place by the police to search for something illegal
raid.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: a dawn raid  (=one made very early in the morning)
Four people were arrested during a raid on a house in London.
raid.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: an attack by criminals on a building where they believe they can steal money or drugs
raid.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: an armed raid on a shop in Glasgow
raid.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: an attempt by a company to buy enough shares in another company to take control of it
raid.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Pirates often made daring raids on the port.
They were encouraged by the French king to carry out raids upon English ships.
They took part in various raids, including the bombing of Cologne in 1942.
His parents were killed in an air raid.
Bombing raids had destroyed most of the country's oil refineries.
There had been two unsuccessful British commando raids.
From their base in the rainforest they staged guerilla raids on Nicaragua.
The night raids were almost non-stop.
Cross-border raids into Kenya last year caused a serious diplomatic conflict.
raid.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if police raid a place, they make a surprise visit to search for something illegal
raid.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Police found weapons when they raided his home.
raid.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to make a sudden military attack on a place
raiding party (=a group taking part in an attack)
raid.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: air bases on the mainland from which the island could be raided
raid.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to go into a place and steal things
raid.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The gang raided three homes in the area.
raid.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to go to a place that has supplies of food or drink and take some because you are hungry
raid.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: Peter went into the kitchen to raid the fridge.
raid.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: an occasion when someone suddenly buys a lot of shares in a company, usually as part of an attempt to take control of it
raid.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: In a successful raid on Emhart Corp., the Fisher-Getty partnership earned a $50 million investment profit.
